p: Based on the severity of symptoms, laboratory parameters and radiologic characteristics, patients are classified as mild, severe, and critical types ( 11). Mild patients had non pneumonia or mild pneumonia with moderate signs and symptoms. Severe patients had numerous clinical symptoms, including fever and cough, blood oxygen saturation less than 94%, partial pressure of arterial oxygen to fraction of inspired oxygen ratio less than 300, respiratory frequency of 30 or more acts per minute, and/ or lung infiltrates more than 50%. Finally, critical patients had severe conditions, such respiratory failure, septic shock, and/or multiple organ dysfunction or failure.
